security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides instructions for using TOON format. It contains no executable code, network calls, or file system access. The skill only contains markdown documentation about data format syntax and validation tools.

content.user_title: Format data efficiently with TOON notation
content.value_statement: JSON wastes tokens in LLM prompts. TOON reduces token usage by 30-60% while keeping data human-readable.
actual_capabilities: Converts tabular data to TOON format with 30-60% token savings
Validates TOON syntax using official CLI tools
Auto-fixes common format errors with Python scripts
Provides format rules and examples for proper syntax
Supports nested objects and multi-line strings
Includes batch validation for multiple files
limitations: Only suitable for uniform tabular data structures
Not ideal for deeply nested or non-uniform data

prompt_templates.title: Convert JSON to TOON
prompt_templates.scenario: You have JSON data that needs TOON formatting
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert this JSON array to TOON format with proper syntax: use explicit count, 2-space indentation, and add blank line after arrays. Here's the JSON: [paste your data]

prompt_templates.title: Validate TOON file
prompt_templates.scenario: Check if your TOON syntax is correct
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate this TOON file and fix any syntax errors: missing counts, wrong indentation, or formatting issues. Show the corrected version: [paste your TOON]

prompt_templates.title: Design tabular structure
prompt_templates.scenario: Plan data layout for TOON encoding
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a TOON format for this data. Show how to structure it as tabular arrays with proper column definitions: [describe your data]

prompt_templates.title: Batch convert documents
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a script to convert these documentation files to TOON format. Include validation and error handling: [list your files]

output_examples.input: Convert a list of API endpoints to TOON format

best_practices: Always validate with npx @toon-format/cli --decode before using in production
Design data structures for tabular representation when possible
Keep JSON as canonical source and generate TOON for LLM transport
Use explicit counts in array declarations to help LLM parsing
anti_patterns: Using TOON for deeply nested or irregular data structures
Including comments or YAML-style lists in TOON files
Forgetting blank lines after tabular arrays
Using commas instead of semicolons for nested arrays in cells

faq.question: Is TOON compatible with standard JSON parsers?
faq.answer: No, TOON requires specialized parsers. Use official libraries for TypeScript (@toon-format/toon) and Python (python-toon).

faq.question: What are the token savings compared to JSON?
faq.answer: TOON typically saves 30-60% tokens by using compact tabular syntax and removing unnecessary punctuation.

faq.question: Can I use TOON for configuration files?
faq.answer: No, use JSON instead. TOON is optimized for LLM prompts, not for tools that expect standard JSON.

faq.question: How do I handle validation errors?
faq.answer: Run the auto-fix scripts in order from validation-tools.md, then re-validate with npx @toon-format/cli --decode.

faq.question: Does TOON support all JSON features?
faq.answer: No, TOON lacks comments, YAML-style lists, and multiline strings. It's designed for tabular data efficiency.

faq.question: When should I choose TOON over JSON?
faq.answer: Use TOON for uniform tabular data sent to LLMs. Use JSON for configuration, APIs, or programmatic data manipulation.
